intro: Phegopyrum cymosum, commonly known as the common phegopyrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its aromatic properties make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
